details:
Several vulnerabilities were fixed in the network traffic analyzer Wireshark.


* [CVE-2021-22207](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-22207)
Excessive memory consumption in the MS-WSP dissector.
* [CVE-2021-22235](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-22235)
Crash in the DNP dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39921](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39921)
NULL pointer exception in the Modbus dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39922](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39922)
Buffer overflow in the C12.22 dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39923](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39923)
Large loop in the PNRP dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39924](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39924)
Large loop in the Bluetooth DHT dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39925](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39925)
Buffer overflow in the Bluetooth SDP dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39928](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39928)
NULL pointer exception in the IEEE 802.11 dissector.
* [CVE-2021-39929](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-39929)
Uncontrolled Recursion in the Bluetooth DHT dissector.


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
2.6.20-0+deb9u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your wireshark packages.


For the detailed security status of wireshark please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/wireshark>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
